title: Wall St. Extends Drop Into Sixth Day, Setting Stage for Another Awful October
summary: American stock markets briefly stabilized early Thursday, as a report showing muted inflation helped send bond yields lower. By late morning, stocks were falling again.

title: It Once Caused Earthquakes. Now a Driller in Britain Tries Fracking Again.
summary: Battling big expense and persistent protests, Cuadrilla Resources returns to again attempt shale gas production after its first effort triggered small tremors.

title: Stocks Bounce Back Around the World After a Week of Selling
summary: Investors may be calming after a spate of bad news drove Wall Street and other global markets down heavily.

title: Energy Partnerships Rebound as U.S. Oil and Gas Output Rise
summary: After a deep decline for funds that invest in energy infrastructure partnerships, it could be time for a turnaround.

title: U.S. Stocks Became Expensive. Are Other Countries Better Bets?
summary: A long bull market made American stocks expensive. Neglected foreign markets may offer better prospects.

title: Wall St. Pins Hopes on Strong Earnings After October’s Ugly Start for Stocks
summary: The quarterly parade of updates on profits and losses will either give credence to fears about the economy or ease them.

title: When Sears Was Everywhere: Espionage, Politics and Fine Art
summary: Over its long history, the retailer has had an influence in some unexpected places.

title: Mnuchin to Decide by Friday Whether to Cancel on Saudi Conference
summary: The disappearance of a Saudi journalist has created an awkward diplomatic situation for the Treasury secretary, who so far has not followed several business leaders in canceling.

title: Fed Plans to Continue Raising Rates, Despite Trump’s Ire
summary: The Federal Reserve released minutes of its last meeting that suggest it is on track to continue raising rates, perhaps to a level that would act as a mild brake on the economy.

title: C.E.O.s May Avoid Riyadh Conference but Not Saudi Money
summary: Even though American and European executives are staying away, companies are unlikely to sever ties or avert future deals after the killing of Jamal Khashoggi.

title: Something New May Be Rising Off California Coast: Wind Farms
summary: The Interior Department is moving to lease parcels in the deep Pacific waters for development, which could help the state meet its clean-energy goals.

title: The Trade War’s Latest Casualties: China’s Coddled Cats and Dogs
summary: Some Chinese pet owners don’t trust local food and will even taste it themselves before serving it. For them, the fight means fewer and pricier choices.

title: $30 Billion in Saudi Deals Even as Investors Denounce a ‘Horrendous’ Killing
summary: An investment conference in Riyadh proceeded, but the killing of the dissident journalist Jamal Khashoggi and Saudi Arabia’s role in it cast a shadow.

title: Stocks Claw Their Way Back From an Early Slide Amid China Worries
summary: Caterpillar set the tone when it warned that tariffs on steel were having an effect on costs, and China’s slowing economy pushed down demand for some 3M products.

title: Turbocharging Jumps From Racetrack to Cul-de-Sac
summary: Industry experts expect that by 2027, more than half the vehicles sold in the United States will include turbo power.

title: A U.S. Trade Complaint, Tech Earnings and Jobs Numbers
summary: Investors will be looking for a turnaround plan from G.E.’s new chief. Data on the eurozone’s economy is due. And Facebook’s earnings will come with data on its user numbers.

title: In U.S.-India Trade, Trump Sees Only Harley-Davidson
summary: India and the United States face deadlines in the coming days to decide disputes over trade and oil. The president is most interested in motorcycle tariffs.

title: U.S. Sanctions on Iran Oil Take Effect, and the Fed Will Meet on Rates
summary: BMW’s earnings may show the effects of the trade war, Disney’s earnings are expected to be strong and E.U. ministers will discuss trade relations with the U.S.

title: China Seeks Allies as Trump’s Trade War Mounts. It Won’t Be Easy.
summary: President Xi Jinping kicks off a Shanghai event showing a growing Chinese appetite to buy from the rest of the world. Even critics of the U.S. have doubts.

title: Their Soybeans Piling Up, Farmers Hope Trade War Ends Before Beans Rot
summary: North Dakota’s soybean crops are flourishing. But China has stopped buying.

title: Iran Sanctions and Oil Prices: Who’ll Feel the Pain?
summary: Markets have taken the Trump administration’s move in stride so far. But experts differ on whether a reduction in output could yet prove disruptive.

title: The Racecars Are Allards. He’s an Allard. There’s Just One Issue.
summary: Head-turning Allards, precursors to the hugely popular AC Cobra, are being built again by Roger Allard, who is not related to the original family.

title: Duterte’s Luster Dulls as Rice Prices Soar in Philippines
summary: The president ordered restrictions on rice imports to be dropped in an effort to tame inflation, but his administration has been widely blamed for mismanaging the issue.

title: ‘Davos in the Desert,’ a Saudi Prince’s Glittering Showcase, Is Stained by a Grisly Accusation
summary: A conference for big investors started last year by Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman has become a symbol of the West’s deepening disillusionment with him after the disappearance of a Saudi journalist.

title: Trump Embraces Foreign Aid to Counter China’s Global Influence
summary: The move is a significant reversal for the president. A new agency will provide $60 billion in financing aimed at blocking Beijing’s ambitions.

title: Kenyans Say Chinese Investment Brings Racism and Discrimination
summary: Episodes involving discriminatory behavior by the region’s growing Chinese work force have unsettled many Kenyans, particularly at a time when their government seeks closer ties with China.

title: Canada is Legalizing Marijuana. Here Are Some Questions, Answered.
summary: As Canada prepares to become only the second country in the world, besides Uruguay, to legalize marijuana, the country is scrambling to get ready.

title: Saudis Issued Dire Warnings Against U.S. Sanctions. But How Much Leverage Do They Have?
summary: The Saudis have a powerful tool in their ability to raise oil prices but are loath to use it. And they could not easily switch to China or Russia for defense.

title: Marijuana Legalization in Canada Has Companies Chasing a Green Rush
summary: The decision by Canada to become the first major economy to fully legalize marijuana this month has created a new, multibillion dollar industry.

title: Legalizing Recreational Marijuana, Canada Begins a National Experiment
summary: On Wednesday, Canada becomes the first major world economy to legalize recreational marijuana, presenting the country with enormous public policy challenges.

title: Mexico’s President-Elect Rethinks His Campaign Promises
summary: Faced with the reality of a limited budget and soaring crime, Andrés Manuel López Obrador is scaling back campaign commitments — even before taking office.

title: Turkey’s President Vows to Detail Khashoggi Death ‘in Full Nakedness’
summary: In taking on the Saudis over Jamal Khashoggi’s death, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan may be fighting a larger, geopolitical battle.

title: How the Migrant Caravan Became a Trump Election Strategy
summary: Activists in Honduras hoped the caravan would damage a president they opposed and help migrants. Instead it precipitated a crisis that hurt them and played into President Trump’s hands.

title: Pakistan Tries a New Way to Pay for a Dam: Crowdsourcing
summary: The financially challenged government asks Pakistanis at home and abroad to donate to a $14 billion dam project. It’s a sign of a much bigger problem.

title: Khashoggi Killing Overshadows Saudis’ Grand Economic Ambitions
summary: The killing of Jamal Khashoggi may be scaring away the foreign partners Saudi Arabia needs to overhaul its economy. Empty seats at a high-profile conference reflect the danger.

title: Mattis Vows U.S. Will Hold Khashoggi’s Killers Accountable
summary: Defense Secretary Jim Mattis’s remarks reflected the administration’s struggle to defend the value of its alliance with Saudi Arabia.

title: Vancouver, Canada’s Marijuana Capital, Struggles to Tame the Black Market
summary: As Canada embarks on a national experiment to legalize marijuana, Vancouver illustrates the difficulties of policing the illegal trade.

title: Mexico’s Incoming President Plans to Cancel Giant New Airport Project
summary: The president-elect will halt construction of a $13 billion airport that is already under construction, prompting protests from the business community and investors.

title: Scientists Warn That World’s Wilderness Areas Are Disappearing
summary: “Wild areas provide a lot of life support systems for the planet,” said the author of a study that found 77 percent of earth’s land had been modified by humans.

title: U.S. Reimposes Sanctions on Iran but Undercuts the Pain With Waivers
summary: Eight countries — including India, South Korea, Japan and China, among the world’s largest importers of Iranian oil — were granted six-month waivers. The European Union did not receive an exemption.

title: Two Capitals, One Russian Oligarch: How Oleg Deripaska Is Trying to Escape U.S. Sanctions
summary: Mr. Deripaska has spent millions building influence in Washington and London. Now he awaits a key decision from the Trump administration.

title: Iran Sanctions Explained: U.S. Goals, and the View From Tehran
summary: The Trump administration just imposed what it called the biggest sanctions action ever taken by the U.S. against Iran. Why? And what may happen next?
